sections.heading: Sentence Adverbs
sections.content:
Sentence adverbs modify entire sentences rather than individual words, expressing the speaker's attitude, judgment, or evaluation about the whole statement. They set the tone, show perspective, or indicate how the speaker views the information.

幸い、間に合った "Fortunately, I made it in time" 正直、分からない "Honestly, I don't understand" 実は、知らなかった "Actually, I didn't know"

children.heading: 幸い/幸いに (Fortunately)
children.content: 幸い、怪我はなかった "Fortunately, there were no injuries" 幸いにも助かった "Fortunately, I was saved" Positive outcome Lucky circumstance

children.heading: 残念ながら (Unfortunately)
children.content: 残念ながら、行けません "Unfortunately, I can't go" 残念ながら失敗した "Unfortunately, I failed" Negative outcome Regrettable

children.heading: 不幸にも (Unfortunately/Unluckily)
children.content: 不幸にも事故に遭った "Unfortunately, I had an accident" More serious than 残念 Misfortune

children.heading: 正直/正直に言うと (Honestly)
children.content: 正直、分からない "Honestly, I don't understand" 正直に言うと、好きじゃない "To be honest, I don't like it" Truthful admission Candid expression

children.heading: 実は (Actually/In fact)
children.content: 実は、知らなかった "Actually, I didn't know" 実は初めてです "Actually, it's my first time" Revealing truth Confession

children.heading: 本当は (Actually/Really)
children.content: 本当は行きたくない "Actually, I don't want to go" 本当は知っている "I actually know" True feeling Real intention

children.heading: もちろん (Of course)
children.content: もちろん行きます "Of course I'll go" もちろん知っています "Of course I know" Obvious fact Strong agreement

children.heading: 確かに (Certainly/Indeed)
children.content: 確かにその通りだ "That's certainly true" 確かに難しい "It's certainly difficult" Acknowledging truth

children.heading: おそらく (Probably/Likely)
children.content: おそらく雨だろう "It'll probably rain" おそらく来ないと思う "I think he probably won't come" High probability Formal estimation

children.heading: たぶん (Probably)
children.content: たぶん大丈夫 "Probably okay" たぶん来ると思う "I think he'll probably come" Moderate certainty Casual than おそらく

children.heading: 驚いたことに (Surprisingly)
children.content: 驚いたことに、彼が勝った "Surprisingly, he won" Unexpected result Astonishment

children.heading: 意外に/意外にも (Unexpectedly)
children.content: 意外に簡単だった "It was unexpectedly easy" 意外にも合格した "Unexpectedly, I passed" Contrary to expectation

children.heading: 案の定 (As expected)
children.content: 案の定、雨が降った "As expected, it rained" 案の定失敗した "Failed as expected" Expected outcome

children.heading: やはり/やっぱり (As expected/After all)
children.content: やはり難しかった "As expected, it was difficult" やっぱり来なかった "After all, he didn't come" Confirming expectation

children.heading: 一般的に (Generally)
children.content: 一般的に、日本人は真面目だ "Generally, Japanese people are serious" General observation

children.heading: 普通 (Normally/Usually)
children.content: 普通はこうする "Normally, we do it this way" Standard way

children.heading: 通常 (Normally - Formal)
children.content: 通常、3日かかる "Normally, it takes 3 days" Standard procedure Formal contexts

children.heading: 個人的に (Personally)
children.content: 個人的には反対だ "Personally, I'm against it" 個人的に好きだ "I personally like it" Own opinion

children.heading: 私としては (As for me)
children.content: 私としては賛成です "As for me, I agree" Personal position

children.heading: ちなみに (By the way/Incidentally)
children.content: ちなみに、明日は休みです "By the way, tomorrow is a day off" Additional information Side note

children.heading: ところで (By the way)
children.content: ところで、昼ごはん食べた？ "By the way, did you eat lunch?" Topic change

children.heading: なお (Furthermore/Moreover - Formal)
children.content: なお、詳細は後ほど "Furthermore, details will be provided later" Additional point Formal writing

children.heading: 明らかに (Obviously/Clearly)
children.content: 明らかに間違っている "It's obviously wrong" 明らかに嘘だ "It's clearly a lie" Self-evident

children.heading: 当然 (Naturally/Of course)
children.content: 当然、反対した "Naturally, I opposed" 当然の結果だ "It's a natural result" Expected outcome

children.heading: 実際 (Actually/In reality)
children.content: 実際、そうではない "Actually, that's not the case" 実際に見た "Actually saw it" Reality emphasis

children.heading: 特に (Especially/Particularly)
children.content: 特に問題ない "No particular problem" 特に好きだ "Especially like it" Singling out

children.heading: 結局 (In the end/After all)
children.content: 結局、行かなかった "In the end, I didn't go" 結局失敗した "Ultimately, I failed" Final outcome

children.heading: 要するに (In short/To sum up)
children.content: 要するに、できないということだ "In short, it means we can't do it" Summarizing

children.heading: つまり (That is/In other words)
children.content: つまり、無理だということだ "That is, it means it's impossible" Clarification

children.heading: ある意味 (In a sense)
children.content: ある意味、正しい "In a sense, it's correct" Qualified agreement

children.heading: ある程度 (To some extent)
children.content: ある程度分かる "I understand to some extent" Partial degree

children.heading: 現在 (Currently - Formal)
children.content: 現在、準備中です "Currently, we're preparing" Present state

children.heading: 最近 (Recently)
children.content: 最近、忙しい "Recently, I'm busy" Recent period

children.heading: 逆に (Conversely/On the contrary)
children.content: 逆に、良かったかもしれない "Conversely, it might have been good" Opposite perspective

children.heading: 反対に (On the contrary)
children.content: 反対に、問題が増えた "On the contrary, problems increased" Opposing result

children.heading: Overusing sentence adverbs
children.content: Too many: 正直、実は、本当は、確かに... ⚠️ Better: Choose one appropriate adverb ✓ Don't stack unnecessarily

children.heading: Wrong positioning
children.content: Unnatural: 分からない正直 ⚠️ Natural: 正直、分からない ✓ "Honestly, I don't understand" Usually at sentence beginning

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 幸い、間に合った "Fortunately, I made it in time" 正直、分からない "Honestly, I don't understand" 実は、初めてです "Actually, it's my first time" もちろん行きます "Of course I'll go" やはり難しかった "As expected, it was difficult"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 実は、日本語を勉強し始めたのは 最近です。正直に言うと、まだ あまり上手ではありません。でも、 一生懸命頑張っています。 "Actually, I started studying Japanese recently. To be honest, I'm still not very good. But I'm trying hard." 残念ながら、今回のイベントは 中止になりました。幸い、 来月また開催される予定です。 ちなみに、参加費は無料です。 "Unfortunately, this event has been canceled. Fortunately, it's scheduled to be held again next month. By the way, the participation fee is free." 確かに、この方法は効果的だ。 しかし、個人的には、もっと 簡単な方法があると思う。 要するに、やり方は人それぞれ だということだ。 "Certainly, this method is effective. However, personally, I think there's a simpler method. In short, the way of doing things differs by person."
